lead_paragraph: The administration’s counterterrorism doctrine aims to spread military responsibilities to regional partners rather than have the United States act alone.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ERIC SCHMITT

headline.print_headline: Mosul Campaign Tests Doctrine of U.S. Support
headline.main: Battle for Mosul Tests Obama Strategy to Shift Fight’s Burden From U.S.

snippet: The administration’s counterterrorism doctrine aims to spread military responsibilities to regional partners rather than have the United States act alone....
abstract: Obama administration says Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi will direct long-awaited campaign by Iraqi forces to retake city of Mosul from Islamic State, despite fact that about half of 5,000 American troops in country will be involved in operation; campaign will be one of toughest tests for Pres Obama's doctrine of aiding regional partners militarily, rather than casting United States as lead in such operations.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
